alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 10:14PM EDT until July 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Belmont County in east central Ohio... Southern Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... * Until 1100 PM EDT. * At 1014 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles east of Cambridge, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... St. Clairsville, Cadiz, Freeport, Antrim, Flushing, Holloway, New Athens, Morristown, Old Washington, Piedmont, Fairview, Deersville, Birmingham, Clendening Lake, Piedmont Lake, Salt Fork State Park, Barkcamp State Park, and Tappan Lake. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 186 and 219. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
